title.narrative: Personalbidrag till FN:s insats i Sydsudan, UNMISS
Personnel to the UN mission in South Sudan, UNMISS

description.narrative: Aktiviteten saknar beskrivning. Kontakta Sida för mer information. Ring +46 8 698 50 00 eller skicka e-post till sida@sida.se.

The Swedish Police Authority has been assigned by the government, through the ordinance on police peace support (1999:1155) and yearly regulation letters, to recruit and make personnel available for international civilian crisis management and peace support operations under the auspices of the United Nations (UN), the European Union (EU), the Organisation for Security and Cooperation i Europe(OSCE) or similar organisations. The United Nations Mission in the South Sudan (UNMISS) is one of the operations to which the Swedish Police Authority contributes with personnel.
Polismyndighetens personal ska bidra till genomförandet av insatsens uppdrag.
That the Swedish Police personnel contributes to fulfill the mission's mandate.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Department of Peacekeeping Operations (only UNIFIL, MINURSO, UNOMIG, UNMIK, MONUC, UNMIL, UNOCI, MINUSTAH, UNMIS, UNMIT, UNAMID, MINURCAT). Report contributions mission by mission in CRS++.

tag.narrative: 16.1 - Avsevärt minska alla former av våld och dödligt våld överallt.
16.1 - Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere.
16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.2 - Eliminera övergrepp, utnyttjande, människohandel och alla former av våld eller tortyr mot barn.
16.2 - End abuse, exploitation, trafficking and all forms of violence against and torture of children.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.

16.a - Strengthen relevant national institutions, including through international cooperation, for building capacity at all levels, in particular in developing countries, to prevent violence and combat terrorism and crime.

16.a - Stärka berörda nationella institutioner, bland annat genom internationellt samarbete, i syfte att bygga upp kapacitet på alla nivåer, i synnerhet i utvecklingsländerna, för att förebygga våld och bekämpa terrorism och brottslighet.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: During 2021, a total of 22 Swedish Police employees were seconded to the mission, this corresponded to 13,8 annual work units. During 2020, a total of 29 Swedish Police employees were seconded to the mission, corresponding to 10,8 annual work units. During 2019, a total of 45 Swedish Police employees were seconded to the mission, corresponding to 21,4 annual work units. During 2018, in average 18 Swedish Police employees (a total of 30 individuals) were simultaneously seconded to the mission. During 2017, in average 15 Swedish Police employees were simultaneously seconded to the mission. During 2016, between 12 and 20 Swedish Police Officers were seconded to the mission. During 2015, in average 14 Swedish Police employees were simultaneously seconded to the mission.

Under år 2021 tjänstgjorde 22 svenska polisanställda (8 kvinnor och 14 män) i insatsen under hela eller del av året, vilket motsvarade 13,8 årsarbetskrafter. År 2020 tjänstgjorde 29 svenska polisanställda (11 kvinnor och 18 män) i insatsen under hela eller del av året, motsvarande 10,8 årsarbetskrafter. År 2019, tjänstgjorde 45 svenska polisanställda (17 kvinnor och 28 män) i insatsen under hela eller del av året, motsvarande 21,4 årsarbetskrafter. År 2018, tjänstgjorde i snitt 18 svenska polisanställda samtidigt i insatsen (totalt 30 individer). År 2017, tjänstgjorde i snitt 15 svenska polisanställda santidigt i insatsen. År 2016, tjänstgjorde mellan 12 och 20 svenska polisanställda i insatsen. År 2015, tjänstgjorde i snitt 14 svenska polisanställda samtidigt i insatsen.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
